title: Can we Talk about Melee carries?
body:
Soon, they're going to be the only untouched class remaining in this game when assassins will be reworked.

Who are melee carries? they are melee that:
-poorly scale with CDR or in general scale better with attack speed/damage/crit rather than CDR: {{champion:23}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:157}}   gangplank is an exception because his damage are 80% from his spells the other 20% is from his passive that scales greatly with AD and with the reset from his barrels it can lead to a lot of true damage.
-they are champions who are able to kill any target in late game and that's why they are called "carries" {{champion:157}} {{champion:114}}  for example

from this definition, {{champion:56}} {{champion:266}}  can also be considered as melee carries,  because they fit  perfectly to the definition

now {{champion:157}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:114}}  {{champion:56}} are perfectly viable (in my opinion) and were picked a lot in competition (except nocturne), unlike {{champion:23}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:266}}  (even when viable he was built like a tank) because let's see what they bring to the table:
- MASSIVE utility, that's what make a pick viable in competition and still strong when behind, and a lot  of ranged carries have utility ({{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:222}} ) 
{{champion:157}}  is able to protect his team from something like miss fortune ulti, has an aoe knock up every 3.99 seconds in late game, his ulti brings something like 600 aoe damage in late game.
{{champion:114}} cc and something like a soraka ulti in late game
{{champion:41}}  global presence, 80% aoe slow, high aoe damage with his ulti.

-a great defense to allow them to teamfight
{{champion:114}}  can dodge everything for a few seconds, and can have a heal.
{{champion:157}}  shield that can be reseted, windwall
{{champion:41}}  a QSS+heal but gangplank can bring damage from a high range.

Now, you perfectly understand the problem of some melees
{{champion:23}} , **needs to pray RNGjesus in early game to win**, 

brings no utility at all, his slow is situational and his AD debuff is flat which falls off in late game, his AD debuff not only is useless against champions that doesn't use AD ({{champion:33}} {{champion:268}}  and mages) but it is also maxed at lvl 13 because you need his spin to be on a low cooldown, which means that in most of the game it will be -20 AD.
he has nothing againt tanks unlike fiora/gangplank/yasuo who have armor pene or true damage, or %hp true damage.
{{champion:11}}  brings no utility and his defensive spell requieres him to stop attacking, he can dodge a spell but he needs to use his Q to get into his target, there is also a small delay before his Q goes off **unlike fiora's W**.

{{champion:266}} **has the most frustrating sustain**

 has the LOWEST damage i ever saw as a carry, does not scale with crit unlike{{champion:23}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:11}}  (his q can crit). his knock up doesn't last enough time to be considered as a good utility. He also has NO spells against tanks like tryndamere.

i feel like at least {{champion:23}}  and {{champion:266}}  should be reworked, feel free to add your opinion
i would like to see how you would manage to make them viable, and not frustrating (like tryndamere or aatrox).

well xin is a champ that i don't really know. I don't even know if he is a carry but what's more is i don't even know if he needs a rework. His kit as a carry is good, it provides him TONS of utility (mini-stun,knock back, knock up, slow) and tankiness for teamfight (ulti armor/mr, sustain). 
**If he were to be underpowered, he could use some buffs.**

At this point, I feel that GP is more of an AD caster and Aatrox more of a drain tank than they are melee carries. That said, I do think that Aatrox, along with Yi and Tryndamere, are in need of a rework. 

Aatrox is basically awful or oppressive depending on the patch, and that's mostly because his kit is a mess. Master Yi brings absolutely nothing to a team other than damage, so if he's not ahead, he's basically worthless. Tryndamere has more or less the same issue as Yi, save for the fact he's a good split pusher, but that's really only enabled by his Ult, which has to be the most inelegant ability still left in the game.

We need to reworks, yo.
Is there any doubt that Gangplank is an AD caster?
I don't think there's much debate in that regard.

I really really hate Yi. His ability to completely disappear every few attacks (late game) is absurd and he only needs two items to do more damage than your adc until they have 4-5. I hate that he isn't very good most of the time but when he's in an ideal situation he feels unstoppable, like when your team has used all of its cc and he can run in and pentakill everyone before they react (largely due to his q making him disappear again) and then push down midlane to the nexus.

Make Yi more than a walking stat stick with an incredibly frustrating kit, please.

Yi has many, many issues, and his mechanically simple kit is the source of most of them. He has very little outplay potential in his kit, be it on his end or the opponent's, so going up against one will only rarely feel rewarding. Then there's that zero utility issue that makes him just as likely to be a hindrance to his own team as he is to be an asset.

Like many other "melee carries," he's a relic of an older, shittier era when Riot was straight up bad at design.
Sure, but has Riot gotten any better at designing melee carries?  I hear just as many players complain about Yasuo's and Fiora's kits.

Yes, Riot has gotten better at it. In spite of the frustration caused by both of those champions, they still have avenues you can use to outplay them other than using hard CC and running away. Not only that, but them getting a kill on someone usually requires more than just right-clicking on someone.

I'd call that an improvement.

They just overload Yasuo and Fiora.

Fiora creating a minigame

Yasuo making him so overloaded, he rarely has any weaknesses, ranged champs don't counter him, and he ends up going too much.

Trynd needs to pray to RNGesus to win the laningphase... But GP needs to pray to RNGesus to win lategame. (assuming the game is close/GPs team is behind)

He only gets one chance to crit with his barrels (usually) and he can't get 100% crit anymore in a legit build... 
Let's say, Karthus' ult damage gets halved, but has a 50% chance to crit and deal double damage... It just creates some really abnoxious situations.

The other side of the coin is that GP with, for example, {{item:3078}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3031}} will deal some absurd damage if he gets the lucky crit with his 20% crit.

That's honestly what bothers me about GP, as a GP main, it creates abnoxious situations for the GP player and those playing vs him...
-Lucky 20% crits can feel really abnoxious for the enemie, especially if GP has a youmuus.
-Lategame it feels like I have to cross my fingers and pray my barrel crits, which can honestly decide if you win or lose the fight.
well http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2236181895/234076208 ADC GP had 100% crit in my game.

I mean... The guy stacked IEs...
He might aswell just buy an ER, same stats, same cost but more mana sustain.
You can't get 100% crit on GP in a ''legit build'' where you're not wasting CDR (TF + ER = 50% cdr) or some other stat/passive...
if i was him, i wouldn't have built trinity force, the sheen damage is nothing compared to the 70 AD of ER.

Wowowowow, Gangplank NEEDS his Trinity force mate!
A build withiout a Trinity force simply isn't a Gangplank build in my eyes.

The Sheen dmg is totally needed. 
Extra dmg on barrels, extra crit dmg, really smooth build path except for the AS item. 
Just look up ehm tobias fate i think. He did the math behind pen builds, full crit builds etc. 
Btw if you are in laning phase and would go for ER you'd need another crit item to reach your CDR cap. 
Now with trinity you have 45% cdr at the twenty minute mark if your laning phase is going well which means 60 second ult+barrel reload. 
So ER would just delay your powerspike further. 
Though i have to admit i still haven't found a pleasant build atm. 
Not reaching the 100% crit is really really really bad. 
Since the LoL God hates us you will never get the crit in a deciding teamfight >.> 
The TF change really fucked up gp...

Hecarim has always been a sort of diver / tank hybrid. He has pretty solid initiation, but even when that's down he can dive into the enemy team and helicopter the backline to shreds. In fact, pure tank Hecarim tends to be kind of lacking, because so much of his kit is focused on damage and diving.

In terms of Evelynn, I think they still _want_ her to be an assassin, but can't really say she currently _is_ one. After all, she's someone who sneaks into or just flat-out runs into the team's squishies and sticks onto them until either her target or herself dies; hell, her ultimate isn't assassin in the slightest, given it's entire % current health damage, its massive slow, and the shield it gives her. The only thing assassin-like to her is her stealth. I don't think she's going to get any focus in the upcoming class reworks; pretty sure they're putting her on the backburner while they figure out if they do want her to continue to be some sort of stealthy diver or focus her more into an assassin role.

This is probably the single most central problem to league and has shaped the design of entire classes (bruiser/tank/assassin) as a result.  People will point to range advantage making melee carries unviable, but at this point, bruisers/tanks/assassins all do as well.  It's a similar problem to that of flash - where the entire game's been balanced around it.

"Melee Carry" isn't really a class, that just means a melee champion that snowballs.

MOst of those can be split up into skirmishers or Divers.

Melee carry doesn't refer to snowbally melee champs, it refers to the melee equivalent of an ADC, ie: an autoattack reliant champion. Most of them happen to snowball well, but that isn't what defines them.

Okay to clarify Melee Carry=Fighter, there are of course fighter's who are not carries but if they do a rework they're going to do fighter's as a whole and all of these fit this.

 AA melee fighter's are kind of falling out of the game, they haven't released one in a REALLY long time because riot HQ just doesn't think it's a fun playstyle and that it adds much to the game. 

Fiora is required to hit her Vital's, if she doesn't her damage is extremely low, her Q actually does less than an auto attack when she doesn't hit a vital and her W's cooldown is horrendously long, she's extremely interactive and has clear cut counter's.

Gangplank has his barrels, he's honestly more of an AD Caster than a fighter.

Yasuo, to be fair his kit is really overloaded but it does interact with the opponent and again has very clear cut counter play.

But then we look a tryndamere...He right-Clicks you and chases you down, he has an "i can't die passive" as well. Yes he does have counter's but he's an AA melee fighter, its kind of hard to counterplay something that requires almost no skill to play because it's all auto attacks. The thing with this playstyle though is that he's basically a hinderance to his team because he can't teamfight at all. But at the same time he can make it feel completely hopeless to the opponent because the mechanics of the champion and AA's just doesn't offer much counterplay at all. The same can be said for Yi and Aatrox

I'd suggest we not say anything about AA Melee Carry's because if we do and they do get changed, you'll probably complain because honestly they need to be made more interactive to the enemy and more satisfying to the player.

i have no opinion specific to the topic of melee carries. 

however, i feel that no champion should have "kill any target late game" as one of their features.

i feel that no matter who you are playing, there should be a bunch of champions that late game will mop the floor with you, and the game is better if the "other team" has a reasonable chance to already have one of them in the team.

for instance i feel that jax should lose to bursty AP champions **if **he is on a full damage build.
